prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a three-dimensional, geometric shape with a triangular base and a rectangular top, connected by a straight line. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and translation vector 0.0, 0.0, 0.002. 2. Begin by drawing a 2D sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system. 3. In the sketch, create face 1 with the following loops and lines: - Loop 1 contains 4 lines: - Line 1 has a start point at (0.0, 0.0) and an end point at (0.5608, 0.0). - Line 2 has a start point at (0.5608, 0.0) and an end point at (0.5608, 0.75). - Line 3 has a start point at (0.5608, 0.75) and an end point at (0.0, 0.75). - Line 4 has a start point at (0.0, 0.75) and an end point at (0.0, 0.0). 4. Scale the 2D sketch by the factor of 0.75. 5. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following properties: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.0 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.002 - Sketch scale: 0.75 - The boolean operation is to create a new solid body. Part 2: Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The height is approximately twice the width, and the length of the sides is equal. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and translation vector 0.3575, 0.4261, 0.002. 2. Begin by drawing a 2D sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system. 3. In the sketch, create face 1 with the following loops and lines: - Loop 1 contains 4 lines: - Line 1 has a start point at (0.0, 0.0) and an end point at (0.0857, 0.0). - Line 2 has a start point at (0.0857, 0.0) and an end point at (0.0857, 0.1969). - Line 3 has a start point at (0.0857, 0.1969) and an end point at (0.0, 0.1969). - Line 4 has a start point at (0.0, 0.1969) and an end point at (0.0, 0.0). 4. Scale the 2D sketch by the factor of 0.1969. 5. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following properties: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.088 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 - Sketch scale: 0.1969 - The boolean operation is to join the current part with the preceding CAD models. The overall final shape of the model will be a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a pointed end, resembling a stylized arrow or a simplified representation of a paper airplane. The dimensions of the parts and final shape are as described in the JSON data provided.</description>
